p: On the other hand, an increase in gelator concentration promotes reorganization of the crystals leading to different microscopy images according to the concentration of gelator used; similar results were observed by Cerqueira et al. ( 2017) in their study on the effect of oil on organogelator structures. Generally, most organogelators organize mesoscale asymmetric structures and do not grow similarly across the three dimensions (Palla et al., 2017). With an increase in gelator concentration, gelation (based on a continuous network, achieved by cross‐linking of the crystals and trapping of the oil) continues until organization of a 3‐D structure immobilizing the oil phase (Cerqueira et al., 2017). Notably, the MG oleogel concentration of 7 had a microstructure with the lowest mass of crystals and the structure became more compact by increasing the concentration to 12% regardless of the storage time.
